title: type id- clean and modern
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121152514im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Bouquet_4736.png)

Any ideas?

 [‹ Font ID: Vogue Living Bold Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121152514/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44560 "Go to previous forum topic") [Type ID. ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121152514/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44918 "Go to next forum topic")
author: cbnnyc

comments.content:
Looks like Din with the lower case e

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-din/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081121152514/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-din/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-din/")
yep and, for what it’s worth, the ’e’ needs to be just a tiny bit stretched to be optically balanced.

Platelet has a similar unicase feel with a bit more character.

- Lex
